intro: Trichocline crispa, commonly known as the hairy crinkled bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, crinkled, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Trichocline crispa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
